1.text: Don’t be envious of evil men; neither desire to be with them:

2.text: for their hearts plot violence, and their lips talk about mischief.

3.text: Through wisdom a house is built; by understanding it is established;

4.text: by knowledge the rooms are filled with all rare and beautiful treasure.

5.text: A wise man has great power; and a knowledgeable man increases strength;

6.text: for by wise guidance you wage your war; and victory is in many advisors.

7.text: Wisdom is too high for a fool: he doesn’t open his mouth in the gate.

8.text: One who plots to do evil will be called a schemer.

9.text: The schemes of folly are sin. The mocker is detested by men.

10.text: If you falter in the time of trouble, your strength is small.

11.text: Rescue those who are being led away to death! Indeed, hold back those who are staggering to the slaughter!

12.text: If you say, “Behold, we didn’t know this;” doesn’t he who weighs the hearts consider it? He who keeps your soul, doesn’t he know it? Shall he not render to every man according to his work?

13.text: My son, eat honey, for it is good; the droppings of the honeycomb, which are sweet to your taste:

14.text: so you shall know wisdom to be to your soul; if you have found it, then there will be a reward, your hope will not be cut off.

15.text: Don’t lay in wait, wicked man, against the habitation of the righteous. Don’t destroy his resting place:

16.text: for a righteous man falls seven times, and rises up again; but the wicked are overthrown by calamity.

17.text: Don’t rejoice when your enemy falls. Don’t let your heart be glad when he is overthrown;

18.text: lest Yahweh see it, and it displease him, and he turn away his wrath from him.

19.text: Don’t fret yourself because of evildoers; neither be envious of the wicked:

20.text: for there will be no reward to the evil man; and the lamp of the wicked shall be snuffed out.

21.text: My son, fear Yahweh and the king. Don’t join those who are rebellious:

22.text: for their calamity will rise suddenly; the destruction from them both—who knows?

23.text: These also are sayings of the wise. To show partiality in judgment is not good.

24.text: He who says to the wicked, “You are righteous;” peoples shall curse him, and nations shall abhor him—

25.text: but it will go well with those who convict the guilty, and a rich blessing will come on them.

26.text: An honest answer is like a kiss on the lips.

27.text: Prepare your work outside, and get your fields ready. Afterwards, build your house.

28.text: Don’t be a witness against your neighbor without cause. Don’t deceive with your lips.

29.text: Don’t say, “I will do to him as he has done to me; I will render to the man according to his work.”

30.text: I went by the field of the sluggard, by the vineyard of the man void of understanding;

31.text: Behold, it was all grown over with thorns. Its surface was covered with nettles, and its stone wall was broken down.

32.text: Then I saw, and considered well. I saw, and received instruction:

33.text: a little sleep, a little slumber, a little folding of the hands to sleep;

34.text: so your poverty will come as a robber, and your want as an armed man.
